sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Maximilian Harden to Schenker, dated May 11, 1894
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Harden urges Schenker to ask Brahms to write something for Die Zukunft about the recently deceased Hans von Bülow.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Nichterscheinen; absence; Leichenfeier; funeral; Denkmal; monument

tei:div.tei:p: könnten Sie Brahms, dem man sein Nichterscheinen bei Bülows LeichenfeierBülow had died on February 12, 1894. sehr verdacht hat, nicht veranlassen, daß er für die Zkft. ein paar Seiten schreibt und kräftig für den Bülow-Denkmal aufruft?After Bülow's death, there was some agitation for a national monument in his honor. Erinnerungen, ein paar Briefe oder dergleichen, was er will. Sie werden ihm rathen und evtl. helfen können. Nachdem in der Zkft. Begas, Lenbach u. a. geschrieben haben, ists doch nichts Auffallendes mehrThe meaning of this clause is presumably this: despite its name, Die Zukunft was hardly a house organ for progressivism, as was proved by its inclusion of articles by such leading traditionalists in their fields as Begas and Lenbach. So Brahms, as a traditionalist, should not have any qualms about appearing in the same company with other traditionalists. und er ists wirklich dem großen Hans schuldig.Brahms disagreed with Harden about the debt owed to Bülow, and about the propriety of a national monument. In later life, Schenker published his recollection of what Brahms said to him in response to Harden's request: "Ich habe nach Hamburg meinen Beitrag zu einem Friedhofs-Denkmal geschickt und hoffe, daß es dabei sein Bewenden haben werde; war doch Bülow schießlich nur ein Kapellmeister, und nicht einmal Richard Wagner hat noch ein Nationaldenkmal." ("I've sent my contribution to Hamburg for a funerary monument, and I hope the matter will rest there; after all, in the final analysis, Bülow really was only a Kapellmeister, and even Richard Wagner doesn't have a national monument yet.") Heinrich Schenker, Die letzten fünf Sonaten von Beethoven ... op. 110 (Vienna: UE, 1914), pp. 23–24; rev. O. Jonas (Vienna: UE, 1972), p. 8; the same reminiscence appears also in Erinnerungen an Brahms, Der Kunstwart 46 (1933), p. 479. Es würde den besten Eindruck machen und ich wäre Ihrer sehr, sehr dankbar. Bitte, sagen Sies ihm in meinem Namen.

Couldn't you induce Brahms, who was very much criticized for his absence from Bülow's funeral, to write a few pages for Die Zukunft, and to come out strongly in favor of the Bülow monument? Reminiscences, a few letters, or the like, whatever he wishes. You will be able to advise him and perhaps help him. Now that Begas, Lenbach, and others have written for Die Zukunft, there is nothing at all incongruous in it, and he really owes it to the great Hans. It would make the best impression, and I would be very, very grateful to you. Please, ask him this in my name.
